required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gait Pattern and Experienced Global Change After Shunt Surgery in Idiopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus
clinical_study.official_title: Gait Pattern, Experienced Global Change, Sense of Coherence, Quality of Life, Anxiety and Depression Symptoms After Shunt Surgery in Idiopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus, in Relation With Healthy Individuals

brief_summary.textblock:
Part 1 Patients with idiopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (iNPH) have variable disabilities regarding gait, balance, cognition and continence. Analysis of the gait pattern in iNPH has an important part in clinical diagnosing and evaluation of outcome after shunt surgery. The gait pattern is only partly explained and more detailed information about gait in iNPH is needed in relation with ordinary clinical measurements.
Part 2 Approximately 70 % of patients with iNPH improve after shunt surgery. Commonly different grading scales and measurements regarding functions are used in the evaluation. To some extent, patients improve in Quality of life after surgery (QoL). In this study, the patient´s own grading of improvements in relation with QoL, sense of coherence (SOC) and symptoms of depression and anxiety are analyzed.

detailed_description.textblock: Consecutive patients with iNPH, which are planed for shunt surgery at the neurological and neurosurgical departments of University Hospital of Linköping, are included. Before operation and 3 months postoperatively, the patient´s gait pattern are analyzed with RehaGait analysis system. The patients also fill in a questionnaire about SOC, QoL and symptoms of depression and anxiety at these assessment sessions. Additionally at the follow up, the patients are grading their overall experienced change and specified changes in gait, balance, continence and neuropsychology with the global Rating of Change Scale (GRC-scale). At baseline and at follow up, the patients also perform the ordinary clinical assessments with measurements covering the domains gait, balance, continence and neuropsychology in the iNPH-scale. A convenience sample of Healthy individuals aged > 60 years, conduct the same questionnaires: SOC, QoL and symptoms of depression and anxiety and perform the RehaGait analysis system once.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Analyzed steps (number).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Analyzed distance (m)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Stride duration (seconds)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Stride length (cm)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Cadence (steps per minute)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Gait phases (seconds)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Heel strike and Toe of angle (angle degree)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Circumduction (cm)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Ankle joint angle (degree of angle)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable: Knee joint angle (degree of angle)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Gait pattern assessed with the Hasomed RehaGait analyzer pro. Variable:Hip joint angle (degree of angle)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Mobile gait analysis system.

primary_outcome.measure: Grading of severity in idiopathic normal pressure hydrocephalus assessed with the Idiopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1 and part 2. Scores 0-100, higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Mobility, walking ability and balance assessed with the Timed up and Go test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 1. Variables: Time in seconds and number of steps.

primary_outcome.measure: Rating of global change assessed with the Global Rating of Change Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Rating at 3 month follow-up for patients.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 2. Scores -5-5 in global change, gait, balance, continence and cognition. Higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Sense of Coherence assessed with the 29 item Orientation to life questionnaire - swedish version (KASAM questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 2. Scores 29-203, higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Anxiety and depression assessed with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 2. Anxiety scores 0-21, Depression scores 0-21, lower scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Health-related quality of life assessed with EQ-5D-5L
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 3 month follow-up for patients. Once for HI.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement in part 2. Scores 5-25, higher scores mean a better outcome.

arm_group.description: Patients with iNPH and shunt surgery.
Healthy controls with similar gender and age distribution as the patients.

intervention.description: Patients are evaluated before and after shunt surgery which is a standard intervention in the clinical practice. HI do not undergo intervention.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients: Al consecutively available patients evaluated for iNPH at Neurology department Linköping University hospital.
HI: Convenience sample among relatives, friends and using advertising.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria for patients:
- iNPH-diagnosis according to the international guidelines (2005)
- Planed for shunt surgery
Exclusion criteria for patients:
- Cognitive impairment that makes it impossible to participate
- Not able to walk 20 meters without walking aids (part 1)
Inclusion criteria for healthy individuals:
- > 60 years of age
- Subjectively healthy without any serious disease
Exclusion criteria healthy individuals:
- Visible gait- or balance disturbance
- Dementia diagnosis
